meanings.definition: Having or showing determination or resolve
meanings.sent1: She made a purposeful decision to study hard for her exams.
meanings.sent2: His purposeful gaze showed his determination to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The purposeful squirrel gathered nuts for the winter with determination.
meanings.sent4: The purposeful march of the ants towards the food source was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The purposeful way the sun rose over the horizon filled her with determination for the day ahead.

meanings.sent1: He gave her a purposeful look before speaking.
meanings.sent2: The purposeful pause in his speech added weight to his words.
meanings.sent3: The purposeful delay in the train schedule caused frustration among passengers.
meanings.sent4: Her purposeful choice of words in the argument left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: The purposeful way the wind blew the leaves in a dance seemed intentional and deliberate.

meanings.sent1: The purposeful smile on her face brightened the room.
meanings.sent2: His purposeful silence during the meeting spoke volumes.
meanings.sent3: The purposeful arrangement of flowers in the vase brought joy to the room.
meanings.sent4: The purposeful melody of the song resonated deeply with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The purposeful way the colors blended in the painting added layers of significance to the artwork.
